std::string comment_

Detailed Description

This class is the base class for all debug value watchers.

It is part of the Watcher Module.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Watcher::Mode

This enumeration is used to specify the type of the watcher.

Enumerator:
WT_INVALID  Indicates an error.
WT_READ_ONLY  Indicates the watched value cannot be changed.
WT_READ_WRITE  Indicates the watched value can be changed.
WT_DIRECTORY  Indicates that the watcher has children.
WT_CALLABLE  Indicates the watcher is a callable function.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Watcher::Watcher ( const char *  comment = ""  ) 

Constructor.

Watcher::~Watcher (  )  [virtual]

The destructor deletes all of its children.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool Watcher::addChild ( const char *  path,
WatcherPtr  pChild,
void *  withBase = NULL 
) [inline, virtual]

This method adds a watcher as a child to another watcher.

Parameters:
path The path of the watcher to add the child to.
pChild The watcher to add as a child.
withBase This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false. This method may fail if the watcher could not be found or the watcher cannot have children.

Reimplemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, and DereferenceWatcher.

void Watcher::fini (  )  [static]

virtual bool Watcher::getAsStream ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequestV2 &  pathRequest 
) const [pure virtual]

This method is used to get a stream representation of the value associated with the path.

The path is relative to this watcher. The stream is comprised of [data type] - (string/bool/int ...) [data mode] - (read only/read write) [data]

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is used.
pathRequest A reference to a Watcher protocol v2 PathRequest containing the stream that we store the watcher value in.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

Implemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, DereferenceWatcher, MemberWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, OBJECT_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, DataWatcher< TYPE >, FunctionWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, CallableWatcher, PyAccessorWatcher, PyObjectWatcher, and SimplePythonWatcher.

virtual bool Watcher::getAsString ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
std::string &  result,
Mode &  mode 
) const [inline, virtual]

This method is used to get a string representation of the value associated with the path.

The path is relative to this watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is used.
result A reference to a string where the resulting string will be placed.
mode A reference to a watcher mode. It is set to the mode of the returned value.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

virtual bool Watcher::getAsString ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
std::string &  result,
std::string &  desc,
Mode &  mode 
) const [pure virtual]

This method is used to get a string representation of the value associated with the path.

The path is relative to this watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is used.
result A reference to a string where the resulting string will be placed.
desc A reference to a string that contains description of this watcher.
mode A reference to a watcher mode. It is set to the mode of the returned value.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

Implemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, DereferenceWatcher, MemberWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, OBJECT_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, DataWatcher< TYPE >, FunctionWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, CallableWatcher, PyAccessorWatcher, PyObjectWatcher, and SimplePythonWatcher.

const std::string& Watcher::getComment (  )  [inline]

static bool Watcher::isDocPath ( const char *  path  )  [inline, static, protected]

static bool Watcher::isEmptyPath ( const char *  path  )  [inline, static, protected]

This method is a helper that returns whether or not the input path is an empty path.

An empty path is an empty string or a NULL string.

Parameters:
path The path to test.
Returns:
True if the path is empty, otherwise false.

void Watcher::partitionPath ( const std::string  path,
std::string &  resultingName,
std::string &  resultingDirectory 
) [static]

This is a simple helper method used to partition a path string into the name and directory strings.

For example, "section1/section2/hello" would be split into "hello" and "section1/section2/".

Parameters:
path The string to be partitioned.
resultingName A reference to a string that is to receive the base name.
resultingDirectory A reference to a string that is to receive the directory string.

virtual bool Watcher::removeChild ( const char *  path  )  [inline, virtual]

Reimplemented in DirectoryWatcher.

Watcher & Watcher::rootWatcher (  )  [static]

This method returns the root watcher.

Returns:
A reference to the root watcher.

void Watcher::setComment ( const std::string &  comment = std::string( "" )  )  [inline]

virtual bool Watcher::setFromStream ( void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequestV2 &  pathRequest 
) [pure virtual]

This method sets the value of the watcher associated with the input path from a PathRequest.

The Path Request is an abstraction of the data associated with watcher path being queried.

NB: For asynchronous watcher set requests this method will always return success.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is set.
pathRequest A reference to the PathRequest object to use when setting the watcher's value.
Returns:
True if the new value was set, otherwise false.

Implemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, DereferenceWatcher, MemberWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, OBJECT_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, DataWatcher< TYPE >, FunctionWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, NoArgCallableWatcher, PyAccessorWatcher, PyFunctionWatcher, PyObjectWatcher, and SimplePythonWatcher.

virtual bool Watcher::setFromString ( void *  base,
const char *  path,
const char *  valueStr 
) [pure virtual]

This method sets the value of the watcher associated with the input path from a string.

The path is relative to this watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is set.
valueStr A string representing the value which will be used to set to watcher's value.
Returns:
True if the new value was set, otherwise false.

Implemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, DereferenceWatcher, MemberWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, OBJECT_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, DataWatcher< TYPE >, FunctionWatcher< RETURN_TYPE, CONSTRUCTION_TYPE >, CallableWatcher, PyAccessorWatcher, PyObjectWatcher, and SimplePythonWatcher.

bool Watcher::visitChildren ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherVisitor &  visitor 
)

This method visits each child of a directory watcher.

NB: This method is a wrapper for the path request implementation of visitChildren.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the children of this object are visited.
visitor An object derived from WatcherVisitor whose visit method will be called for each child.
Returns:
True if the children were visited, false if specified watcher could not be found or is not a directory watcher.

virtual bool Watcher::visitChildren ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequest &  pathRequest 
) [inline, virtual]

This method visits each child of a directory watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the children of this object are visited.
pathRequest The path request object to notify for each child owned by the directory watcher.
Returns:
True if the children were visited, false if specified watcher could not be found or is not a directory watcher.

Reimplemented in DirectoryWatcher, SequenceWatcher< SEQ >, MapWatcher< MAP >, DereferenceWatcher, PyObjectWatcher, and SimplePythonWatcher.
